abstract: New series of courses at 15 New York City high schools is aiming to make students aware of the politics, marketing and demographics of the food industry; curriculum is based on one developed by nonprofit group, Food-Fight, whose founders set out to change the way adolescents think about food.
snippet: A new series of courses at 15 New York City high schools is aiming to make students aware of the politics, marketing and demographics of the food industry.
lead_paragraph: A new series of courses at 15 New York City high schools is aiming to make students aware of the politics, marketing and demographics of the food industry.

headline.main: In High Schools, a Critical Lens on Food
headline.print_headline: In High Schools, a Critical Lens on Food
headline.seo: FoodFight, a Nonprofit Group, Works With New York City Schools
